title: How do the authors whose books I read through Kindle Unlimited get paid? - Quora

response.answer_text: Authors get paid from a large pool of money. Each month, Amazon decides how much money goes into the pool and divides it by the total number of pages read that month across all books. It’s typically around $0.005/page, sometimes more, sometimes less. You don’t need to read each and every page to satisfy book completion. At the moment, they don’t record which specific pages have been read (that would be a huge amount of data to keep track of!). Instead, they record the last page you read. So, if you skip to the end, the author will be credited for every page in between. Authors are only paid once for a borrowed book. No matter how many times you read the same book, the author only gets paid once.

Amazon monitors the pages you have read and pays authors on the number of pages read. Authors aren’t very happy with the system since there have been a number of attempts to scam the system and get high ‘page reads’. Some people (who don’t deserve the title author) put links at the front of their very large and boring book to a page at the back of their book. Amazon’r early software took that as a whole book read.To counter that Amazon introduced ‘page flip’. That upset authors even more because some people are reading the entire book in that mode and Amazon counts that as a single page read. So if you feel the author deserves to be paid—don’t read in ‘page flip’ mode.
